LongDescription: A highly modified drive commonly found on scouting or quick response warships. This drive is equipped with automated safeties and reinforced housing, allowing a warship to stay in flank speed with a reduced chance for damage while also increasing overall linear speed.  Due to the increased thrust output demand, this drive generates less power than similar models.
FlavorText:
Engineers nicknamed these 'Raider' drives since you'd usually find these on pirate corvettes with a worrying number of questionable modifications by the crew. I've only worked on a few of these in my career, but it's not uncommon to find even the military variants lined with jury-rigged repairs, something the Brass warns (but is powerless to stop) as a 'very dangerous practice'.

Doesn't stop the maintenance crews, though. Hell, it didn't stop me either. When you start running out of parts, the idea of a little DIY repair becomes pretty tempting.

- I. Parker, CMC
FormattedBuffs:

Linear Thrust: <color=#4CFF72>+40%</color>
